May 19, 2025

Sentiment Analysis on Amazon's 10-K Reports (2021-2025)

A programming for finance project utilizing R for sentiment analysis of Amazon's MD&A sections and comparison with financial metrics.

This project, developed for a university course in Programming for Finance, focuses on conducting sentiment analysis on the Management's Discussion and Analysis (MD&A) sections of Amazon's 10-K annual reports from 2021 to 2025. The core objective was to extract and quantify sentiment from textual data and then analyze its correlation with key financial performance indicators.

The Challenge

Analyzing large volumes of unstructured textual data, such as corporate financial reports, to extract meaningful insights can be challenging. The goal was to develop a systematic approach to quantify the sentiment expressed by management in their MD&A sections and observe how this qualitative aspect aligns with quantitative financial figures.

Tools and Methodology

Programming Language: R

Text Mining: Used pdftools, tm, and stringr to extract and clean the MD&A sections.

Sentiment Dictionary: Loughran-McDonald Master Dictionary (1993â€“2024).

Scoring: Sentiment = (Positive Words - Negative Words) / Total Words.

Visualization: ggplot2 used for plotting sentiment trends against financial metrics.

Financial Data: Pulled from Yahoo Finance using the quantmod library.

Key Findings & Impact

  • Sentiment Trend: Sentiment was mildly positive in 2021 and showed a steady increase from 2023 to 2025.
  • 2022 Dip: Only 2022 showed a notable drop, reflecting financial loss, tax risks, and post-pandemic uncertainty.
  • Financial Alignment: Sentiment scores largely align with Amazon's financials, dropping in 2022 with losses and rebounding as profitability returned.
  • Revenue vs. Sentiment: While revenue rose steadily, sentiment dipped in 2022, revealing internal struggles.
  • Stock Return Correlation: Stock returns mostly followed sentiment, except in 2025, where high sentiment contrasted with a dip in returns, likely due to external factors like the U.S.-China trade war.
  • 2022 Inflection Point: Across all metrics, 2022 stands out as a critical inflection point. Despite record revenue, the company faced a net loss, operational inefficiencies, and adverse external conditions, all contributing to a pronounced drop in sentiment.
  • Recovery Reflection: The subsequent recovery in financial performance is mirrored by steadily improving sentiment scores, affirming the value of sentiment analysis in interpreting not just financial outcomes, but also management's outlook and internal assessment of challenges.
  • Qualitative Proxy: This comparative framework highlights how sentiment acts as a useful proxy for qualitative factors not fully captured in raw financial data.
